intro: Linochilus apiculatus, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
